title: Cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome
summary: Cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome (CHS) is recurrent nausea, vomiting, and cramping abdominal pain that sometimes occurs due to prolonged, high-dose cannabis use.[3] [4]These symptoms may improve temporarily by taking a hot shower or bath.[1] Complications may include kidney failure, electrolyte problems, and skin burns from hot water.[1] At least five deaths have been associated with CHS.[1][5][6][7]
